perturbation.original_text: 3.4  Invoices. WGT will issue invoices for the Products ordered by Distributor      and all other amounts payable to WGT under this Agreement. Distributor will      pay WGT the full amount invoiced within thirty (30) days after the date of      WGT's invoice, unless provided otherwise on the applicable invoice, in the      lawful money of the United States of America to WGT by wire transfer of      immediately available funds to WGT's bank account number 1141139, at the      Commerce Bank of Washington, 601 Union Street, Suite 3600, Seattle, WA      98101, ABA routing number 125008013.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.4  Invoices. WGT will issue invoices for the Products ordered by Distributor      and all other amounts payable to WGT under this Agreement. Distributor will      endeavor to pay WGT the full amount invoiced within a reasonable time frame after the date of      WGT's invoice, in the lawful money of the United States of America to WGT by wire transfer of      immediately available funds to WGT's bank account number 1141139, at the      Commerce Bank of Washington, 601 Union Street, Suite 3600, Seattle, WA      98101, ABA routing number 125008013.
perturbation.explanation: Section 3.4 originally states that 'Distributor will pay WGT the full amount invoiced within thirty (30) days'. The modified text replaces 'will pay WGT the full amount invoiced within thirty (30) days' with 'will endeavor to pay WGT the full amount invoiced within a reasonable time frame', removing the defined deadline and replacing it with a vague term. This introduces a contradiction regarding payment terms, causing uncertainty regarding the agreed payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1  Term. The Term will commence on the Effective Date of this Agreement and      will remain in effect, unless sooner terminated under paragraphs 5.2, 5.3,      or 5.4, until the termination date specified in Exhibit A.

The Term will automatically renew for successive additional periods of one (1) year each, provided that: (a) Distributor has made all Guaranteed Minimum Purchases and has complied with the marketing requirements under paragraph 4.1(b); (b) the parties have agreed in writing upon the Guaranteed Minimum Purchase amounts and Product price discounts for the next subsequent one (1) year renewal period; (c) neither party provided the other party with notice of such party's intention not to renew this Agreement at least thirty (30) days prior to any year's Expiration Date; and (d) neither party provided the other party with such notice as may be required pursuant to paragraphs 5.2, 5.3 or 5.4.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1  Term. The Term will commence on the Effective Date of this Agreement and      will remain in effect, unless sooner terminated under paragraphs 5.2, 5.3,      or 5.4, until the termination date specified in Exhibit A.

The Term may renew for successive additional periods of one (1) year each, provided that: (a) Distributor has made all Guaranteed Minimum Purchases and has complied with the marketing requirements under paragraph 4.1(b); (b) the parties have agreed in writing upon the Guaranteed Minimum Purchase amounts and Product price discounts for the next subsequent one (1) year renewal period; (c) neither party provided the other party with notice of such party's intention not to renew this Agreement at least thirty (30) days prior to any year's Expiration Date; and (d) neither party provided the other party with such notice as may be required pursuant to paragraphs 5.2, 5.3 or 5.4.
perturbation.explanation: Section 5.1 originally says 'The Term will automatically renew'. The modified text says 'The Term may renew'. The original text implies an automatic renewal assuming conditions are met. The change to 'may renew' introduces uncertainty on whether it will renew, even if the conditions are met, making it discretionary and contradicting the implied automation.

perturbation.original_text:
14.  Warranty; Returns. WGT will permit Distributor and end-users purchasing      through resellers to return any defective Product in accordance with the      limited warranty contained in the applicable end-user license agreement or      limited hardware warranty, as applicable, provided that the Distributor and      end-user have compiled with the applicable warranty terms and conditions.

     In order to receive the remedy provided for hereunder, Distributor shall deliver to WGT a sample of the Product which Distributor finds to be      defective in workmanship or materials, or damaged in shipment prior to      Distributor assuming the risk of loss or damage , along with a written      explanation of the alleged defect within thirty (30) days from the later of      Distributor's initial receipt of such Product from WGT or from the delivery      of such Product to an end-user.
perturbation.changed_text: 14.  Warranty; Returns. WGT may permit Distributor and end-users purchasing      through resellers to return any defective Product based on WGT's discretion and internal policies. In order to even be considered for the remedy provided for hereunder, Distributor may deliver to WGT a sample of the Product which Distributor finds to be      defective in workmanship or materials, or damaged in shipment prior to      Distributor assuming the risk of loss or damage , along with a written      explanation of the alleged defect. The timing is determined upon WGT's own discretion.
perturbation.explanation: Section 14 originally implies that returns of defective products 'will' be permitted, provided the conditions are met. The modified text changes this to 'WGT may permit', introducing an element of discretion. Furthermore, removing the 'within thirty (30) days' deadline and replaced with 'The timing is determined upon WGT's own discretion' again creates an internal contradiction on the procedures, making it unclear under what circumstances returns are accepted and what the deadlines are.
